column4: so, earlier tonight I was told that to compile a kernel you just tupe make and that does it, bt it did not work, it says "command not found"
so how do I do it?
even if make is found, it isn't anywhere near that simple
but first, it appears that you need to install make, which is part of the development essentials
don't panic, it is quite possible, but not quite that simple
you have me on an emotional rollercoaster
start by installing the  missing development stuff, you'll get nowhere without it
that's ok, just hit control-c
if you type make, it will ask you a bunch of questions
but why is it you insist that you want to "just type make"?
someone told me to do that ealrier
so, after a bit of work, you'll compile the kernel
but if you convince yourself that you don't have to do any work, what happens when you get to a step you don't understand?
I dig down deep, swallow my pride and move onwards
there is no need to swallow anything.  Just take ten or fifteen minutes, read a how-to, and go do it.
I think you are helpful... this time I will try harder to find a tutorial
go to kernel.org, there are several of them
that was easy... I am dumb :P
a developer is just a user who isn't scared to compile.  :)
don't delete the kernel you already have that works.  Add the new one, don't replace the old one
then, if it doesn't work, you can always boot the old, working kernel
smart move
make the older one the default, then select the new one at the grub menu
